questions.question: Failure modes and effects analysis involves what activity?
options: The determination of the probability of failure in a specified period of time
The expected number of failures in a given time interval
The study of failure to determine how a product fails and what causes the failure
A study of the probability of success in a given time period
questions.answer: The study of failure to determine how a product fails and what causes the failure

questions.question: Inherent or intrinsic reliability
options: Is that reliability which can be improved only by design change
Can be improved only by a state of the art improvement
Is that reliability estimated over a stated period of time by a stated measurement technique
questions.answer: Is that reliability which can be improved only by design change

questions.question: Which of the following safety and liability statements is true?
options: Safe products start in the fabrication of manufacturing stage
Labeling the product as having specific limitations has little impact on liability
A manufacturer may not be held responsible if a product has changed hands
As long as a product is in operation a manufacturer can be held liable in the case of bodily injury
questions.answer: As long as a product is in operation a manufacturer can be held liable in the case of bodily injury

questions.question: Maintainability is:
options: The probability of a system being restored to functional operation within a given period of time
Improved only by a state of the art improvement
The probability of survival of a system for a given period of time
Maintaining a machine in satisfactory working condition
questions.answer: The probability of a system being restored to functional operation within a given period of time

questions.question: A corporation makes a product which is a blend of three ingredients (A, B, and C). If the individual tolerances for the weights of the three ingredients are as shown, what would be the tolerance for the blended product? Ingredient A: 66 +- 3.0 grams, Ingredient B: 20 +- 2.0 grams, Ingredient C: 14 +- 1.73 grams
Which of the following quality management principles would one apply to increase the probability of better quality?
options: Drawings and specifications should be rigidly set with nominal enforcement
Drawings and specifications should be realistically set with rigid enforcement
Drawings and specifications should be under the direction of quality engineering
Drawings and specifications should be rigidly set and rigidly enforced
questions.answer: Drawings and specifications should be realistically set with rigid enforcement

questions.question: For a shaft with a specification of 1.000" +- 0.005", what is the MMC? (most material allowed by the tolerance)
Reliability, maintainability, and product safety improvements are most often economically accomplished during which of the following phases?
New products will have a greater chance of success if they have which of the following characteristics?
On blueprints, thin lines with arrows at each end and numbers placed near their midpoints, specifying a part size, are called:
The principal purpose of robust design techniques is to:
options: Make the product less sensitive to noise effects
Use the tools of experimental design
questions.answer: Make the product less sensitive to noise effects

questions.question: On blueprints, the extreme measurements permitted by the maximum and minimum size of the features of an object are called

The stage gate process is used by many companies to screen and pass projects, but many companies fail to use the process properly. A common problem in the stage gate process, that could negate its benefits, would be:
options: Too many kills in the system

questions.question: If the mean time between failure has been found to be 13 hours for a given radar system, what is the reliability of the radar at t = 13.2 hours? (exponential formula for reliability)
The risk priority number is used when:
A design review is conducted for the purpose of:
options: Verifying the details of all the drawings
Verifying the accuracy of all the specifications
Verifying workmanship quality of the drawings
Verifying the completeness and accuracy of the overall design package
questions.answer: Verifying the completeness and accuracy of the overall design package

questions.question: The ratio of the probability density function to the reliability function for the exponential distribution is:
The house of quality is used to translate customer wants into engineering design variables. The linking of prioritizing of customer wants into engineered values occurs in what element?
Specifying a tolerance by +0.000" -0.001", is known as:
Which of the following is best suited for modeling the reliability of a complex piece of equipment?
A product development process should consist of:
options: A relay team of function-to-function specialists

questions.question: A component has a constant failure rate. The variance of the time to fail distribution is 100, what is the mean time to fail?
Preventive maintenance can be justified as cost effective when:
options: A system life is determined by MTTF
A complex system consisting of many components is involved
The system is in a constant failure mode
The corrective maintenance cost can be significantly reduced
questions.answer: The corrective maintenance cost can be significantly reduced

questions.question: A surface of revolution (a cylinder, cone, or sphere) is considered which of the following when all points on the surface intersected by a plane are equidistant from the axis?
A reliability data system usually implies collecting data on:
Criminal liability involving injury cases may be invoked in all of the following areas?
Formal release of a new design for production is authorized by:
When making a drawing, the draftsperson should select views with the fewest hidden lines becuase:
options: The object can be dimensioned properly
One needs four views to make the object clear
The fewer hidden lines on the drawing, the easier it is to understand
The object will be easier to draw
questions.answer: The fewer hidden lines on the drawing, the easier it is to understand

questions.question: Parts in use during the random failure or normal portion of the part life cycle curve will exhibit:
The qualification of a sophisticated product would entail:
The primary reason that nonconforming material should be identified and segregated is:
options: So that the cause of nonconformity can be determined
So it cannot be used in production without proper authorization
To obetain samples of poor workmanship for use in the company's training program
So that responsibility can be determined and disciplinary action taken
questions.answer: So it cannot be used in production without proper authorization

questions.question: Using ANSI/ASQ Z1.4 for a lot of 1,000 parts, a general inspection level II, the code letter J, an AOL of 1.0%, and a sample size of 80, what is the accept number?
In the pre-production phase of quality planning, an appropriate activity would be to:
options: Assess the capability of the entire quality organization
Determine the technical depth of available manpower in design engineering
Establish compatible approaches for accumulation of data
Conduct process capability studies to measure process expectations
questions.answer: Conduct process capability studies to measure process expectations

questions.question: Even though sampling presents some disadvantages, which of the following is a valid reason for its continued widespread use
options: It is more accurate than 100% inspection
It is less expensive than full inspection
It requires less administrative expense that a full inspection
It generates less scrap than 100% inspection
questions.answer: It is less expensive than full inspection

questions.question: Where inspector efficiency is defined as the ratio of correct decisions to the total decisions regarding individual items, most inspection operations performed by human inspectors are approximately:
The most significant elements of a material review report are the identification of the type of defect and:
options: The identification of the discrepant parts or materials
The identification of the operation in which the defect was introduced
A detailing of the quality history of the process
questions.answer: The identification of the discrepant parts or materials

questions.question: Once a quality level has been established, attribute sampling costs can be effectively lowered (with relatively small risks) by:
options: Sampling only those locations in the batch that are observed to contain defectives
Reducing the number of inspectors required
Switching from an attribute plan to a variable plan
Reducing the number of samples such as going from single to double sampling
questions.answer: Reducing the number of samples such as going from single to double sampling
